entries.title: Less food for the same price: 'Shrinkflation' is on the rise in France
entries.description: France has confirmed some companies shrink their products in size or quantity – even sometimes reducing their quality – while maintaining or increasing their prices.

entries.title: 'Arte Europe Weekly,' a new multilingual broadcast
entries.description: Thirty years after its birth, Arte is positioning itself as a European-wide television channel. A growing number of programs are offered in languages other than French and German, like this Saturday news program.

entries.title: Pension reform: The left hopes to transform day of strikes into public opinion victory
entries.description: To prevent the movement from losing steam, representatives of the NUPES left-wing alliance want to present their own counter-arguments to the government's position.

entries.title: 'It's impossible to live as a retiree': The French pensioners who choose to continue working
entries.description: In 2019, nearly 400,000 people who officially retired were still working, and the number is only growing.

entries.title: Canada promises 200 armored personnel carriers to Ukraine
entries.description: This latest donation is part of $500 million in Ukraine military aid the Canadian prime minister announced in fall.

entries.title: Iran: Concern grows for French-Irish citizen on dry hunger strike over his detention
entries.description: Bernard Whelan's family say his detention is for reasons 'beyond our comprehension.'

entries.title: In Syria, businesses experience extortion from Bashar Al-Assad's regime
entries.description: To replenish the state coffers, tax authorities shakedown the companies they inspect.

entries.title: 'Germany holds the key to accelerating Western military assistance to Ukraine at this strategic moment'
entries.description: Delivering Leopard tanks or authorizing European countries to hand them over to Ukraine is a major decision for Berlin, which has been very reluctant until now, writes columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

entries.title: In Japan, the Moonies are at the heart of the political apparatus
entries.description: The Unification Church has built up a broad network within Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), relying on front organizations and common values.

entries.title: Israeli Supreme Court blocks minister appointment, amid legal rift
entries.description: Israel's high court ruled that the influential head of the ultra-Orthodox Shas party Aryeh Deri was disqualified from serving as a minister after being convicted for tax offences.

entries.title: Microsoft cuts 10,000 jobs, about 5% of global workforce
entries.description: The tech giant is the latest to cut its workforce, after Amazon and Facebook's parent company Meta laid off thousands of their own staff.

entries.title: 'The rank-and-file employee is the unexpected star of the WEF in Davos'
entries.description: The US' Inflation Reduction Act has left some European business heads in an uproar, and has put the rank-and-file worker in the spotlight after Covid-caused shortages, says Philippe Escande, business editor at 'Le Monde'.

entries.title: French city asks Madonna for loan of lost artwork
entries.description: The French city of Amiens believes the Queen of Pop may be the current owner of a major painting lost there in WWI.

entries.title: French government presents plan for fight against 'forever chemicals'
entries.description: The Ministry of Environmental Transition presented a plan to reduce exposure to these highly toxic chemicals on Tuesday.

entries.title: Moderna touts positive late-stage results for bronchiolitis jab
entries.description: The US biotech reported positive phase III trial results for its bronchiolitis mRNA vaccine targeting the elderly on Tuesday.

entries.title: Scotland Yard shaken by another scandal of serial rape by a police officer
entries.description: Less than a year after a young woman was murdered by a police officer, another officer has confessed to dozens of rapes, further damaging the reputation of this prestigious institution.

entries.title: Newly-appointed German defense minister to decide on aid to Kyiv
entries.description: Until now, Boris Pistoriushas laid relatively low in German politics. Now, he is taking charge of Germany's Bundeswehr while the country is under pressure to increase its aid to Ukraine.

entries.title: 'Babylon': Once upon a time, Hollywood was the capital of sin
entries.description: Damien Chazelle paints a picture of the city of cinema in the 1920s, during the transition from silent to talking movies.

entries.title: Mexico City, a 'precarious sanctuary' for Latin American journalists threatened with death
entries.description: 2022 broke all records with 17 journalists murdered in Mexico, 12 of them for reasons directly related to their work.

entries.title: Brazil: 'The Three Powers Plaza in Brasilia is not doomed to become a graveyard of democracy'
entries.description: Historian Laurent Vidal explains the deeply democratic symbolism that presided over the construction of this square, which was the target of the attempted insurrection.

entries.title: Number of asylum seekers in France climbs back to pre-Covid-19 levels
entries.description: More than 130,000 asylum applications were submitted in France in 2022 with most of the demand coming from Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Turkey.

entries.title: UK government seeks to restrict protest rights to stem climate activists
entries.description: On Monday, Downing Street presented a bill allowing police to preemptively arrest people planning 'serious disruption' operations.

entries.title: Pension reform: Philippe and Bayrou, Macron's two dissonant allies
entries.description: With Edouard Philippe and François Bayrou setting their sights on the 2027 presidential election, their positions on the government's pension reform are particularly significant.

entries.title: Ukraine interior minister among 18 dead in helicopter crash near Kyiv
entries.description: The helicopter fell near a kindergarten and a residential building. There was no immediate word on the cause of the crash.

entries.title: Escaped tiger euthanized in South Africa after attacks
entries.description: The 8-year-old female Bengal tiger attacked a man and killed several animals.

entries.title: Sri Lankan asylum seekers in Indian Ocean rekindle France-UK tensions
entries.description: More Sri Lankan migrants are seeking asylum on France's Réunion Island. Some of them stop over on a small British island on the way.

entries.title: Nadal knocked out of Australian Open
entries.description: The defending champion lost out in the second round of the tennis tournament to 65th-ranked Mackenzie McDonald after suffering an injury.

entries.title: Strong offshore earthquake hits eastern Indonesia
entries.description: The country's climate agency warned of possible aftershocks following the quake that took place 150 kilometers northwest of the eastern island of Halmahera.

entries.title: In the battle over pensions, 'Emmanuel Macron is like a war chief without any weapons'
entries.description: As in many previous crises, the French president must face the social movement alone for lack of any political heavyweights in his orbit.

entries.title: Ursula von der Leyen's plan to win the green industry battle
entries.description: Looking to challenge China and the US, the European Commission is outlining an EU industrial policy.

entries.title: In France, business bankrupcies in 2022 were up by nearly 50%
entries.description: In 2022, 42,500 legal proceedings were filed. While this level is still lower than a 'normal' year, the catch-up to previous levels is happening rapidly.

entries.title: In South Africa, a missing tigress is causing panic and reviving the debate on big cat breeding
entries.description: After escaping from her enclosure on Sunday, 8-year-old Sheba has already attacked a man and killed two dogs, a pig and a deer.

entries.title: French shellfish farmers press charges against local government for environmental damage
entries.description: The harvesting of shellfish in the Thau lagoon has been recently prohibited due to the presence of a norovirus. The farmers' union blames the city of Sète of water pollution.

entries.title: 'In China, the purge imposed on Didi, Alibaba, Tencent or JD.com seems to be over'
entries.description: The Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Global has announced that it has received green light from its regulator for the downloading of its 25 apps banned in China.

entries.title: Australian Open: Players spared from extreme heat in Melbourne
entries.description: Day two of the Grand Slam tournament was disrupted by stifling heat, with matches halted in accordance with a rule introduced in 2019 to protect players.

entries.title: K-Pop, Lizzo, Metallica: Ten concerts in France to book now
entries.description: The top concerts you should see in Paris, according to 'Le Monde'.

entries.title: End-of-life care in overburdened hospitals: 'My father just wanted to die with dignity'
entries.description: Le Monde journalist Vanessa Schneider recounts the last years of the life of her father, the writer and psychoanalyst Michel Schneider. At a time when end-of-life care is prominent in public debate, this story says a lot about the failure to care for such patients.

entries.title: Maria Ressa, Philippine Nobel prize winner, acquitted of tax evasion
entries.description: The founder of online media company Rappler says that the charges against her were politically motivated and that her court victory provides 'hope'.
